Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 274.
_description: ‘A goodly Preaer’ — fifteen stanzas rhyme royal

CULGg431.First Lines:
Blessed god sovereange goodnesmercy to me þi synfull
                    creaturethogh fre wyll be grawnted me all largesseyet thys wrecched
                    body my freale nature…
CULGg431.Last Lines:
…With angelles & seyntes syngyng In kyndsanctus sanctus
                    sanctus lord god with owte end
CULGg431.Attributed Title:
A goodly preaer (f. 104); finis huius orationis (f.
                    105v)

HunHM501.First Lines:
Blessid god souereyn goodnessemercy to me thy synfull
                    creature…
HunHM501.Last Lines:
…with angellis & seinttis synggung in kyndSanctus
                        Sanctus Sanctus lord god with out ynd
HunHM501.Editions:
Brunner,  Karl. 
             “Ein typisches Bufsgedicht aus dem fünfzehnten Jahrhundert.” 
             Anglia
         59 (1935): 322-7: 324-7.
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XVth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1939: 86-9.
